{"step_by_step_thinking": "If continuous hypersensitivity develops in a recently restored tooth, it indicates that the tooth is still sensitive to external stimuli. This could be due to various reasons such as incomplete sealing of dentinal tubules, inadequate restoration material, or underlying pulpal inflammation. This may involve removing the restoration and applying a desensitizing agent such as a zinc oxide eugenol (ZOE) cement to provide temporary relief.
